title: 111_hr5647
content: The Act is titled the "Responsible COBRA, Unemployment, and Poverty Extension Act" and includes provisions for extending unemployment insurance. The Act extends unemployment insurance deadlines from June 2, 2010, to September 30, 2010, and from November 6, 2010, to March 1, 2011, in various sections. The Act, 2008 is amended to include new provisions related to COBRA, unemployment, and poverty extension. The amendments made by this section are effective as if included in the Continuing Extension Act of 2010. The Act, 2008 is amended to include new provisions related to COBRA, unemployment, and poverty extension. SEC. 3. EXTENSION AND IMPROVEMENT OF PREMIUM ASSISTANCE FOR COBRA BENEFITS. The eligibility period for COBRA benefits is extended from May 31, 2010, to September 30, 2010. Additional rules are added for individuals experiencing a qualifying event related to employment termination after June 1, 2010. The amendments made by this section regarding continuation coverage programs will take effect as if included in the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009. SEC. 4 extends the use of 2009 poverty guidelines until September 30, 2010. SEC. 5 rescinds $27 billion from unobligated funds under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 to offset increased spending. SEC. 6 requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to report the amounts rescinded to congressional committees. SEC. 6. DETERMINATION OF BUDGETARY EFFECTS. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by the latest statement submitted by the Chairman of the House Budget Committee. The Act is designated as an emergency for pay-as-you-go principles and statutory paygo requirements.
